text: what AWS has done it has enabled us
enabled me my team and our
management to launch these services that
have never been done at the speed at
which we have done in the past and we
hope to do it in the future my name is
Sunil sajani and I'm the senior vice
president of Enterprise technology um at
Hurst Corporation times have changed the
expectations of my internal customers
have changed they need to go to the
market much faster we need to be agile
we need to be nimble and the traditional
way of deploying technology just did not
afford us to do that when we were
looking at um AWS and we did compare it
with some of the other um comp competing
products and services AWS had the depth
of the portfolio and the services and
the feature set that they were coming
out with on a regular basis that
impressed us the most we are currently
going through a data Center assessment
exercise a consolidation exercise we've
got 29 data centers spread out globally
within all these
regions we feel that running data
centers is not a core competency for
Hurst we have just finished an uh an
exercise of 10 data centers assessment
and by January we should be starting
major workloads into AWS today we are
using probably about 30 terab of our
data warehouse but that's not even
onethird of the data that's out there
within
her had we gone through the traditional
route of not going to AWS would have
taken maybe eight or nine engineers and
dbas and so on to put it all together
with a sizable infrastructure investment
in the case of the data warehousing it
would have cost us a few million dollars
to put it all together we probably
including the Staffing that we have and
the services that we pay AWS for we
probably did it under a million dollars
in 1/5 the time that it could have been
done so there's a heavy activity going
on throughout the corporation um to take
advantage of different regions and the
capability of from a Dr standpoint which
is what we didn't have in many of our
businesses and because of the design
that AWS affords us we have that inbuilt
capability not only to have redundancy
and failover but also backup
capabilities so there are many examples
uh that uh I can come up with including
majority of our magazines we have moved
most of our public facing uh websites to
AWS you know we've got 21 us titles
we've got 300 international editions in
um probably 40 plus languages in 170
countries I mean I can go on and on with
stats but there's a huge opportunity for
AWS for me for my organization to take
advantage of that diversity and the
portfolio we have to move these Services
into AWS and get out of the business of
running it get out of the business of
running data centers because we want to
be Brokers of the service and that's
what AWS enables us to do
